main event: A witness observed a bright, pulsating, and tumbling light, about 60 feet in diameter, at an altitude of 1,000 feet, moving in a straight line with a slight oscillation in Wisconsin in September 1952.
interesting points: The light seemed to change color and gave off sparks.
There was no radar contact in the local area.
The speed and motion of the object were not consistent with an aircraft.
The report notes that the duration of the sighting was too short for it to be a satellite, and the visual phenomena observed were not characteristic of a satellite either.
sighted object: a bright, pulsating, and tumbling light about 60 feet in diameter
